forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Clear. Low around 45, with temperatures rising to around 47 overnight. East northeast wind 5 to 12 mph, with gusts as high as 22 mph.

forecast.name: Tuesday
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly sunny. High near 58, with temperatures falling to around 56 in the afternoon. North northeast wind 6 to 9 mph.

weather_report:
As evening descends upon Downtown San Francisco, the air carries a crispness that hints at the cold night ahead, with temperatures poised to dip to the mid-forties. The cityscape is bathed in a tranquil clarity, the sky revealing a sleepy blue illuminated only by scattered lights twinkling from the buildings below. The east-northeast breeze, while gentle, adds an invigorating sharpness, perfect for those who revel in the briskness of winter evenings.

Tomorrow promises a mostly sunny reprieve, where the sun will stir the city awake, beckoning dwellers to embrace the day with optimism. With a high near fifty-eight, the afternoon will gradually cool, inviting layers to combat the briskness that often lingers. Given the pleasant conditions tomorrow, it may be a good day for quiet strolls along the waterfront or a visit to one of the city's charming cafes, perhaps to savor a warm cup of coffee, as the bay glimmers invitingly. Dress in light layers to fully enjoy the brisk air without sacrificing comfort.
